page.title: 03GLOUCESTER OLD SPOT
page.content: The Gloucester Old Spot is a rare breed of pig with a few black spots and a strange eye. Many of the pigs have won cups and prizes at shows and contests. It is good quality meat and for a time it was virtually extinct. However Graham Brown got hold of some and has bred them successfully. When they get to 4 years old they are slaughtered. Some of the names of the sows here are:Princess Mary, Star, Princess Joan, Countess, Bluebell, Dolly, Josephine, Muriel, Dahlia, Princess Anne, Ellen, Princess Freda, Primrose, Princess, Star Marie and Star Antoinette. They are inter-related and Princess Mary gave birth to most sows in January (68) and to most gilts in January (50). Altogether 611 piglets were born in January this year.
